definition: conflict/to conflict/clash of opposing forces/collision (of interests)/contention
thoroughfare/to go straight ahead/to rush/to clash
(of water) to dash against/to mix with water/to infuse/to rinse/to flush/to develop (a film)/to rise in the air/to clash/to collide with
to dash/to move forward quickly/to bulge/to protrude/to break through/to rush out/sudden/Taiwan pr. [tu2]

sentences.english: They may also have personality differences which can cause conflict.
sentences.chinese: 他们所具有的个性差异也可能会引起冲突。

sentences.english: While traditional hot-spot issues remain unresolved, new conflicts break out from time to time.
sentences.chinese: 传统热点依旧，新的冲突时有发生。

sentences.english: On the other hand the West should not be panicked into unnecessary confrontation.
sentences.chinese: 其次，西方世界不该惊慌于同中国的冲突。

sentences.english: Do you think China should play the role of an arbitrator in the dispute between India and Pakistan ?
sentences.chinese: 你认为中方是否应该在印巴冲突中充当调解者的角色？

sentences.english: There is no conflict of fundamental interests among third world countries.
sentences.chinese: 第三世界国家之间没有根本的利害冲突。

sentences.english: Obert: I see that would create a conflict of interest.
sentences.chinese: 我了解这会造成利益冲突的情形。

sentences.english: The issue of the conflict isn't as black and white from the lens of the priest in the temple.
sentences.chinese: 庙方祭师认为，冲突不能用非黑即白两分法论断。

sentences.english: Like geo-political conflicts or the global economy, they are too big.
sentences.chinese: 就像地域冲突或全球经济，它们太大了。

sentences.english: Protesters also clashed with security in the troubled city of Port Said.
sentences.chinese: 抗议人士还在塞得港和警方发生冲突。

sentences.english: The burden is on the developer for resolving these conflicts.
sentences.chinese: 解决这些冲突的负担落在了开发人员身上。

sentences.english: Those often-conflicting desires aren't addressed by existing development practices.
sentences.chinese: 现有的培养实践不能解决经常冲突的愿望。

sentences.english: This collision had a very unusual cause.
sentences.chinese: 这次冲突有着非同寻常的原因。

sentences.english: Occasional regional and local armed conflicts flare up, and economic competition is becoming ever more acute.
sentences.chinese: 局部地区的武装冲突时有暴发，经济竞争更为加剧。

sentences.english: Both countries are nuclear powers and are keenly aware that a conventional military conflict would not be easily contained.
sentences.chinese: 两国都是核大国，都很清楚传统的军事冲突不易控制。

sentences.english: Billions of young people want to move beyond the shackles of poverty and conflict.
sentences.chinese: 数十亿年轻人想摆脱贫困和冲突的镣铐。

sentences.english: The boys suffered loneliness, homesickness, "Pommy bashing" and culture shock.
sentences.chinese: 他们不能融入当地社会，还遭遇文化冲突。

definition: to dispute/to disagree/to argue opinionatedly/to wrangle
to oppose/to set sth against/to be antagonistic to/antithetical/relative opposite/opposing/diametrical
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
